summary_comment: Sapna Singh, a Design Professor at The Ohio State University, is known for her challenging classes and outdated teaching methods. Her lectures are described as boring and have not been updated since 2007. Students find her difficult to understand and learn from, and she is reportedly rude when handling issues both in and out of the classroom.
summary_comment_short: Sapna Singh is a Design Professor at The Ohio State University known for her tough and challenging classes. Her lectures are described as boring and outdated, with little improvement since 2007, and she is often perceived as rude, both in-class and regarding issues outside of it.

Ratings.comment: Tough class.
shes the goat

Sapna Singh is a Design Professor at The Ohio State University. To start, participation/attendance is mandatory and she is extremely difficult to understand and learn from. She is very rude when dealing with problems that occur inside or outside of the classroom. Her lectures are very boring and haven't been updated since 2007. Be cautious with her

summary_comment: Professor Hejny is highly knowledgeable and provides excellent feedback, making him very accessible both inside and outside of class. Students find his assistance invaluable for understanding complex material. His classes, while potentially required, are described as engaging and worthwhile.
summary_comment_short: Professor Hejny is highly knowledgeable and provides excellent feedback, making him very accessible both in and out of class. Students find his classes valuable and enjoyable, even when required.

Ratings.comment: Very knowledgable and helpful! Provides great feedback and is generally accessible outside of class for any issues. If you're reading this the class is probably required for you anyway but you'll have a good time!

summary_comment: Professor Winegardner is a personable and effective instructor, particularly supportive for beginners in design. While occasionally unorganized and prone to lengthy presentations, his clarity and thorough explanations make him a valuable teacher.
summary_comment_short: Professor Winegardner is highly regarded for his clear explanations and supportive approach, making him an excellent choice for beginners in design. However, some students note that he can be unorganized and his lectures sometimes run long.

Ratings.comment: Zach is extremely personable and helpful in his feedback--perfect for students just starting in design. He's quirky but super fun to be in class with and explains everything clearly and thoroughly! Loved taking his class.
New and young professor. Sometimes he is unorganized and his presentations are long but he is a very good professor.

summary_comment: Professor Swearingen is highly regarded for his passion and dedication to his students, creating a uniquely creative and inspiring learning environment. However, his courses lack structured guidance, often leaving students to learn more from their personal explorations than from direct instruction. Despite this, his approach is highly recommended for those interested in game design, offering a pioneering and open-minded curriculum.
summary_comment_short: Professor Swearingen is highly regarded for his dedication to student learning and creativity, creating an inspiring and open environment for game design. However, his approach lacks structured guidance, often leaving students to learn more from their personal explorations than from direct instruction.

Ratings.comment: Prof. Swearingen is a great professor that really cares for his students and the practice. The environment he creates is really creative, though there is an unfortunate lack of structure. Often I felt I was learning more from my personal struggles than from Scott as a teacher. Still a great course, just don't expect step by step learning.

My time with Prof. Swearingen was truly inspiring. I've never taken a course this open and creative before, it was an amazing experience. If you have an interest in learning game design, be it traditional or otherwise, this is a great place to start.

SEI.Subject: ACCAD
SEI.Class Name: Computer Game Art and Design II

SEI.Subject: ACCAD
SEI.Class Name: Computer Game Art and Design I

summary_comment: Professor Fernandez offers an easy yet interesting class where students can excel with minimal effort if they attend and stay engaged. However, his grading is perceived as arbitrary, and his repetitive presentation style, despite varying the order of slides daily, fails to provide substantive review or additional value.
summary_comment_short: Professor Fernandez offers an easy yet interesting class with clear expectations for success, provided students attend and engage. However, his grading is perceived as arbitrary, and his repetitive lecture format without substantive review is criticized by students.

Ratings.comment: Really easy, but interesting class. If you show up and pay attention, youll have no issues doing really well in the class.
Super Arbitrary Grading and he does the same presentation slides every day in a different order, as if we haven't seen them before. But this isn't reviewing because the lecture isn't helpful.

SEI.Subject: DESIGN
SEI.Class Name: Introduction to Visual Communication Design I

summary_comment: Professor Shade is widely regarded as one of the worst instructors at Ohio State, with students citing unclear directions, disorganized lectures, and a condescending attitude as major issues. Many find his class confusing and unhelpful, with assignments and projects often left vague and requiring repeated clarifications. While some note that he is willing to help with questions and provide feedback, the overall consensus is negative due to his lack of preparedness and poor communication skills.
summary_comment_short: Professor Shade is widely regarded as one of the worst instructors at Ohio State, with students citing unclear directions, disorganized lectures, and a condescending tone as significant issues. Many students find his classes frustrating and unhelpful, with few learning meaningful content and many recommending avoidance.

Ratings.comment: One of the worst professors that I have ever had while at Ohio State. Directions and expectations for the assignments are never clear and you spend the entirety of his lectures asking questions about them to which he answers vaguely and with a condescending tone. Lectures are not organized and do not have a clear central idea. Avoid if you can.

The most unclear teacher I have ever had. His directions never make sense. Most class time is spent with him answering students' questions about his unclear directionsand still they don't make sense. He then forces students to present, and gets upset when his directions were not followed perfectly. I am yet to learn something in his class.

Homework assignments & projects are vague with no clarity whatsoever. You need to ask multiple times in order to get some distinct answer. Gives condescending nonverbals when your presentation doesn't match his criteria. Double check your system grades because it might not match his inputted grades are. Don't take his classes unless you need it.

Spends class reading directly off lecture slides and provides no insight or additional information. Projects and homework assignments are vague and it often takes several questions from multiple people in class before clarity is provided. His logic regarding student participation is often weirdly wrong. Dont take this class if you dont have to

some assignments can be unclear but Kurt will always clarify assignments if asked. He pushes his students to do their best work. Lectures can be unclear of what direction they are going but he always has a point to what he is showing or has you do. Always offers constructive feedback and has you identify your own strengths and weaknesses.

awful experience in his class,  worst teacher i've ever met.  can't understand his point   :(      what he read to us, we have learned in another design class. everytime i take this class, it makes me wonder why i am here!!!!

He would stay after class to help you with your work. He also is very helpful when you ask him to clarify on how certain assignments should be done. I highly recommend him if you have a good sense of humor and are willing to ask questions.

Unprepared, disorganized, unclear. Shows up late frequently after the first day when he locked students out of the classroom that weren't there on time. Incredibly rude and disrespectful. Doesn't even look at the assignments or lectures (by someone else) before he gives them, and then just reads them to us.
Not respected. First day of class said he had a "pet peeve" for people being late. Second day of class walks in 10 minutes late. Very unclear instructions

summary_comment: Professor Hardy struggles significantly with effective teaching despite possessing deep knowledge in her subject area. Students find her unapproachable and unorganized, with frequent cancellations and poor communication. Many had to self-teach extensively to succeed in her class.
summary_comment_short: Professor Hardy struggles with effective teaching despite having strong subject knowledge. Students found her unapproachable and unorganized, leading to frequent cancellations and a need for self-study to succeed.

Ratings.comment: I genuinely liked Sara as a person and she was helpful when approached in class, but she was uninterested in teaching. Difficult to contact by email and cancelled class frequently (but don't skip or you'll fail). She knows her stuff and is good at it, but can't teach it effectively. I taught myself a lot and had to work extremely hard for the A.

The worst professor Ive ever encountered. Enough said. She is the most unorganized person and is very unprofessional. Clearly not interested in teaching. Left wondering what exactly I paid for bc I taught myself everything.

SEI.Subject: DESIGN
SEI.Class Name: Design Media I for Interior Design

summary_comment: Professor Haase is highly regarded for his engaging and supportive teaching style, offering interesting and challenging projects that receive thorough and consistent feedback. He is known for his approachability and humor, which help maintain student interest over extended coursework periods. However, his lack of graded assessments throughout the semester left students uncertain about their performance.
summary_comment_short: Professor Haase is an exceptionally engaging and supportive instructor who makes complex material manageable through interesting and challenging projects, providing consistent and valuable feedback. However, his lack of grading throughout the semester left students uncertain about their performance.

Ratings.comment: Jeff is a genuinely awesome professor. His projects were interesting and challenging, and he gave a ton of great feedback throughout the entire semester to make sure everyone was on the right track. He's goofy and understanding and made this extremely long class manageable, but didn't grade anything all semester so I had no idea what my grade was.

summary_comment: Professor Snyder is highly regarded for her excellent teaching quality, providing helpful feedback and clear project expectations. While the class material is challenging, she is understanding and offers generous classwork time and extensions when necessary. Students strongly recommend taking her class again.
summary_comment_short: Professor Snyder is highly effective, providing thorough feedback and clearly outlining project expectations. Despite the course's challenging nature, she generously offers extra classwork time and extensions, ensuring students feel supported throughout the semester.

Ratings.comment: Super great, gives helpful feedback, and is very clear about project expectations. The class can be heavy but she is very gracious with classwork time and extensions if needed. Overall, I would take it again.

summary_comment: Professor Sabatelli's class is generally considered one of the easiest non-CSE tech electives, with minimal workload and no midterms or finals. The course consists of brief lectures and light weekly assignments, making it suitable for students with heavy course loads. While some find the content and lectures somewhat lacking in practical information, others appreciate its manageability and useful content, particularly for minors or general education requirements.
summary_comment_short: Professor Sabatelli's classes are generally considered easy and manageable, with minimal workload and no midterms or finals. Lectures are mostly straightforward, with some interesting content, and the class structure allows for flexibility and additional credit opportunities.

Ratings.comment: Easiest non-CSE tech elective so far. No midterms, no final exam, and honestly, very doable with other heavy lifting courses.

There is about a 45-minute lecture and little work otherwise.  Each week takes about 1-2 hours which is great for a fully online 3 credit class.  The class is easy and there is extra credit.  Some of the topics are interesting, so if you put the lectures at 1.5x speed, it'll be a good class either for the minor or GE.
Inconsiderate and ignored emails

A very easy course, that doesn't contain much practical information. The lectures were pretty long for the messages they were trying to get across, and I usually would just go through the slides quickly on my own. Not very much work in the course, with weekly quizzes and only two essays, so I would recommend if you need easy credit.

Extremely manageable course. Madison is understanding and flexible. Coursework consists of a weekly quiz or discussion post and 2 larger assignments (essays around 1500-2000 words). Interesting and useful content.

I took this class as a part of the Entrepreneurship and Innovation minor, and found it surprisingly enjoyable despite not being my particular field of interest because the class also focuses on designing students future career paths. The class has 2 lectures, a mini quiz, and a discussion post per week, and two papers throughout the class.

SEI.Subject: DESIGN
SEI.Class Name: Design Media I for Interior Design

SEI.Subject: DESIGN
SEI.Class Name: Design Media II for Interior Design

SEI.Subject: DESIGN
SEI.Class Name: Design Media I for Interior Design

SEI.Subject: DESIGN
SEI.Class Name: Design Media II for Interior Design

SEI.Subject: DESIGN
SEI.Class Name: Design Media I for Interior Design

SEI.Subject: DESIGN
SEI.Class Name: Design Media II for Interior Design

summary_comment: Professor Valentine is considered one of the worst professors by students, known for confusing feedback and tough grading, especially for foundational courses. While some appreciate her helpfulness and care, many advise seeking frequent meetings and detailed process documentation to improve grades. Overall, her teaching style and grading criteria pose significant challenges, particularly for those without prior design experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Valentine is widely regarded as one of the worst design professors, according to student comments, due to confusing feedback and difficulty in obtaining good grades without extensive interaction and detailed processes. Students find her tough on grading, especially for foundational courses, and recommend seeking frequent meetings and clear communication to improve their standing.

Ratings.comment: Save yourself and try to get another design professor definitely the worst professor I've ever had!

Confusing feedback. Grades fair if you are a 2nd or 3rd year student, I do NOT recommend her for foundations courses unless you already have design experience. Nice, but you HAVE to talk to her frequently and have extensive details on your process post to get a good grade( its not extensive, but for someone from a technical major it feels like it).
Emily's grading is pretty tough but she is very helpful IF YOU ASK FOR IT. Feedback can sometimes be confusing from her but she has proven very caring and helpful if you ask to meet with her.

I am a junior and she is definitely my least favorite professor I have had. She does not value creativity and grades very inaccurately. Her personal artwork is very poor so I think it is just a reflection of how she views others art. I would highly recommend taking Zach Winegard's design instead. He teaches the same course and totally ROCKS!!
Emily can be unwavering, but she teaches design well and responds to emails quickly.

SEI.Subject: DESIGN
SEI.Class Name: Materials, Process, and Production for Interior Design

summary_comment: Professor Shen's lectures consist solely of reading slides, with assignments lacking clear instructions and rubrics, leading to confusion about grading criteria. Students find her feedback insufficient and unhelpful, often receiving vague responses or being directed to re-read assignments. Her approach to project feedback also appears inconsistent, as graded issues do not align with previously discussed points during meetings.
summary_comment_short: Professor Shen's lectures consist solely of reading slides, with assignments lacking clear instructions and rubrics, leading to confusion about grading criteria. Students find her feedback inadequate and unhelpful, often receiving vague responses or being directed to re-read assignments without substantive guidance.

Ratings.comment: Lectures are just reading slides and assignments have little instruction and no rubric, no reasoning behind grades.
6 hours a week mandatory attendance for only 3 credits hours. Not very helpful feedback. Not a clear direction.

She doesnt give good directions on assignment descriptions so you wont know how to complete them without asking and she doesnt respond to emails. When she does respond, she is unhelpful and just tells you to read the assignment again. On projects when she grades you she brings up things that you never discussed when you met for feedback.

SEI.Subject: DESIGN
SEI.Class Name: Design Media I for Visual Communication Design

summary_comment: Professor Swearingen is highly regarded for inspiring creativity and personal growth among her students, despite her impressive background in production animation. While her students find her inspiring and her expertise valuable, they note that her teaching methods can be challenging, with limited in-class support and an unorganized course structure that relies heavily on self-directed learning.
summary_comment_short: Professor Swearingen inspires students to excel and fosters creativity, despite her impressive background in production animation. While her expertise is evident, her teaching methods can be lacking in structured guidance and organization, often leaving students to learn independently.

Ratings.comment: She really inspires students to be better and creative. She is humble even if she has an amazing profile.
She's amazing!

Prof. Swearingen has an impressive background in production animation, her experience is apparent. However, this does not always transfer to her ability as an instructor. In-class help is light, forcing students to teach themselves through tutorials or trial/error. The class is also one big project, so there are no grades. Fairly unorganized course

SEI.Subject: ACCAD
SEI.Class Name: 3D Computer Animation: Form, Light and Motion I

SEI.Subject: ACCAD
SEI.Class Name: 3D Computer Animation: Form, Light and Motion II

SEI.Subject: ACCAD
SEI.Class Name: 3D Computer Animation: Form, Light and Motion I

SEI.Subject: ACCAD
SEI.Class Name: 3D Computer Animation: Form, Light and Motion I

SEI.Subject: ACCAD
SEI.Class Name: 3D Computer Animation: Form, Light and Motion II

SEI.Subject: ACCAD
SEI.Class Name: 3D Computer Animation: Form, Light and Motion I

SEI.Subject: ACCAD
SEI.Class Name: 3D Computer Animation: Form, Light and Motion II

SEI.Subject: ACCAD
SEI.Class Name: 3D Computer Animation: Form, Light and Motion I

SEI.Subject: ACCAD
SEI.Class Name: Group Studies in Digital Animation and Interactive Media

summary_comment: Professor La Luz Hawkins is widely regarded as one of the worst instructors, according to student feedback. She is described as unapproachable, unclear in her directions, and condescending, often leaving students confused and frustrated. Her frequent absences and lack of support outside of class further contribute to a poor learning experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor La Luz Hawkins is widely regarded as one of the worst instructors, characterized by her unresponsiveness to student questions, unclear directions, and a dismissive attitude towards student concerns. Students consistently report a lack of availability, frequent cancellations of classes, and vague or non-existent rubrics, leading to confusion and frustration throughout the course.

Ratings.comment: The worst professor I've ever had (and it's not even close). She refuses to actually answer questions. Split the class into 15-18-person groups and didn't follow up on if it was working. Unclear on directions and expectations. Very condescending both in person and over email. Other Professors were shocked at how poorly run this class was.

I've never had an instructor care less about her students. Susana was unclear on directions and when students. would ask for clarification she was very rude to them. I hope OSU finds someone else to teach this class

Susana hasnt showed up to more than 6 classes this semester because she was on vacation. Telling you that you need to change your perspective if you are wanting an A in the class. She thinks that a C is a good grade cause you learned something. Its not like shes ever there to tell you otherwise and she doesnt give any rubrics. Gaslit always.

Professor skipped class frequently. Harsh grader sometimes and absolutely terrible descriptions for assignments given. Expect constant confusion in Susannas class with a complete lack of help or explanation. She is never available outside of class for help either. Overall the worst professor Ive ever had, though passing the class is not difficult

Inconsiderate. Does not put in the effort to teach. Any misunderstandings are your fault and she refuses to take blame for anything. Despite more than half of the class not understanding. Do not take any of her classes if you can. If you must, may God be with you and your sanity.

While she was knowledgable about research, class was cancelled constantly and the first half of the class was graded solely on completion while the second half was graded extremely meticulously. Assignment sheets and expectations weren't clear at all and all the grades except one are entirely dependent on what your group members do and don't do.

summary_comment: Professor Fromme is highly regarded for his engaging teaching style and detailed feedback, though students note he can be disorganized and sometimes unclear about grading criteria. His classes are homework-heavy but flexible with deadlines, and he encourages attendance and office hours use. Overall, while there are organizational challenges, his insights and supportive approach make the class manageable with consistent effort.
summary_comment_short: Professor Fromme is highly regarded for his engaging teaching style and detailed feedback, though students note he can be disorganized and sometimes unclear about grading criteria. Despite these challenges, many find his classes valuable and manageable with consistent effort.

Ratings.comment: This guy is GOATED. Very nice guy. Class is a little weird but it's a little fun.

Prof Fromme was good. His class is kinda homework heavy, especially doing the actual designs but you have so much time to get stuff done and the grading criteria is clear. He has structured it so all the homework you do is used in the final project so stay on top of the assignments. It's easy to get behind.

Took 3105 this semester. Adam has great insight into the material he teaches and always seemed invested in describing it to us. His verbal feedback is very detailed, but there were times where posted material wouldn't cover some crucial details. Despite this, the class was very engaging without weighing in on my stress.

Professor Fromme is a bit disorganized with the content and sometimes posted it quite late, sometimes right before class. However, he is very flexible with deadlines if you email him and the content he teaches is engaging. If you take this class put effort into your designs and most of all go to his office hours! He gives great feedback and advice.

This class was easy. You have to put in the work and he will give you an A. You must go to class. He is extremely unorganized and it is frustrating at times because you don't know what the grading criteria is for projects. Final exam is all short answer. Sometimes doesn't email back when you ask questions. But he brings donuts to class so...

SEI.Subject: HCINNOV
SEI.Class Name: Foundations of Innovative Healthcare Design Thinking

SEI.Subject: HCINNOV
SEI.Class Name: Foundations of Innovative Healthcare Design Thinking

SEI.Subject: HCINNOV
SEI.Class Name: Foundations of Innovative Healthcare Design Thinking

SEI.Subject: HCINNOV
SEI.Class Name: Foundations of Innovative Healthcare Design Thinking

SEI.Subject: HCINNOV
SEI.Class Name: Foundations of Innovative Healthcare Design Thinking

summary_comment: Professor Olsen is highly regarded for his caring and supportive approach, often spending extra time to help students improve their work and providing a relaxed yet focused learning environment. Students appreciate his kindness and the ample work time provided, though some note that the pace might be slower, making it less intense for those preparing for a rigorous portfolio. Overall, he is seen as a great instructor who effectively manages the course load and helps students succeed.
summary_comment_short: Professor Olsen is highly regarded for his caring and supportive approach, dedicating time to help students improve their work and providing a relaxed yet focused learning environment. His courses are praised for their manageability and the clear instructions provided, though some students note that the relaxed atmosphere can make it challenging to maintain a serious mindset for portfolio preparation.

Ratings.comment: Taylor is truly one of the best professors I've had so far. He cares about each one of his students and will take the time to sit down with you and give suggestions about how you could take your work up to the next level. I would definitely recommend taking his for foundations!!

Taylor is truly the best professor I have had. He helped me significantly through projects and course work. It is definitely a relaxed studio environment, that allowed for a lot of personal work time. He is very kind and definitely helped me in working toward getting accepted to my major after design foundations.

Such a nice person and super funny, but unfortunately I didn't feel like I learned as much as I did from other design profs. He's so chill that it makes it difficult to take anything too seriously, which isn't a great mindset to have when getting ready for a foundations portfolio. I would still recommend him, just know it'll be insanely relaxed.

Taylor created a super relaxed but focused environment in his class. I really appreciated how much work time we got, and his instructions were very clear. The three projects were not super hard, and using Taylor's feedback you should be able to create a good project with a good grade.

Taylor is a great instructor. He is very caring and understanding of each student's strong and weak points in design. The course itself is manageable for a major course. There are 3 "Modules" throughout the semester, which are all individual projects with design exercises incorporated. I always looked forward to his course.

summary_comment: Professor Beecher is highly regarded for maintaining an organized and manageable course load. Students appreciate the consistent and early assignment of homework, allowing ample time for completion. The assessment structure, consisting primarily of regular quizzes and occasional papers, provides clear expectations and a steady workload.
summary_comment_short: Professor Beecher provides clear and consistent course materials, offering homework well in advance to manage student workload effectively. The teaching approach focuses on regular, manageable assessments including quizzes and occasional papers, fostering a structured learning environment with minimal need for additional out-of-class support.

Ratings.comment: Mary was great. I never really had to reach her outside of class. All the homework was given like 3 weeks in advance so you had plenty of time to complete it. It was just 5 quizzes per module and then one paper here and there. You know your workload and it really isn't a lot if you work on it once a week.

SEI.Subject: DESIGN
SEI.Class Name: Advanced Design History: Interiors, Contents, Communication, and Culture

SEI.Subject: DESIGN
SEI.Class Name: Advanced Design History: Interiors, Contents, Communication, and Culture

SEI.Subject: DESIGN
SEI.Class Name: Advanced Design History: Interiors, Contents, Communication, and Culture

summary_comment: Professor Tippery is known for his relaxed teaching style and ability to make design principles accessible, particularly for beginners. His classes are described as easy and informative, with engaging content that encourages students to explore the subject further. Students highly recommend his course for both its academic value and its ease of earning good grades.
summary_comment_short: Professor Tippery is known for his relaxed teaching style and easy class structure, focusing on basic design principles suitable for beginners. He is highly regarded for his engaging lectures and inspirational content, encouraging students to explore the subject further.

Ratings.comment: really chill and a good teacher. class is pretty easy, really basic design principles. it is really catered to people who dont have a design background or knowledge.

Gabe is awesome!  He showed us some very inspirational videos and encouraged me to dive further into the field to learn more.  The class was very interesting and informative.  I definitely recommend this it!  Not only is it an easy A, but he also introduces you to some very interesting discussions.

summary_comment: Professor Rudd is known for providing clear, helpful feedback and encouraging participation, which contributes significantly to the course grade. Her classes are generally considered easy with open-note exams and manageable projects. However, some students find her PowerPoint presentations subpar and prefer the involvement of the Teaching Assistants, though these can sometimes lack depth. Overall, Rudd is viewed as caring and approachable, making the course accessible for those who attend regularly.
summary_comment_short: Professor Rudd is known for providing clear, helpful feedback and encouraging participation, which leads to an easy A for students who attend and engage. However, some students find her PowerPoint presentations subpar and the material somewhat outdated, with the TA's often failing to provide meaningful explanations.

Ratings.comment: A very nice professor who gives clear, helpful feedback, and is usually not a tough grader as long as you are putting in obvious effort. Participation was a large part of this course. Gives interesting and interactional lectures. Also really caring. Not many complaints, if any at all.

I think her teachings in textiles and clothing field is outdated and it did not have edge of designs like design major, but not science oriented like real chemical engineering major and not business oriented like true business major. This makes this study under her very mediocre at best.

she is good. but her ppt are extremely bad. she always lets TA to teach but they seldom teach us something useful. They all just read the ppt and don't give us any explanation about the academic terms. I never recommend her class.

The TA's would get to lecture sometimes. Rudd was cool and provides many personal examples to help explain content. Participation is encouraged and we have some interesting discussions in class. Text book not needed just take notes in manual. Interesting class, make sure you go and assignments were easy. Final project not to hard. Open note exams.
Midterm makes up most of your grade!!!

The class was very interesting and was an easy A. All the tests are open-note and the projects and worksheets are by far manageable and almost fun to do. Professor seemed to care a lot about the subject and the TA's were very involved and helpful

She's alright, it's an easy class so if you show up and take notes on your manual there's no way you could fail. Open note midterms and quizzes. One major project but it's about personal identity so it's super easy. She is not very engaged as she is gone often times and has her TA's take over. They all come off as stuck up but they're alright

She is very intelligent but is also very pretentious. As long as you go to class, you should get an A, this was literally the easiest class I have ever taken. She also offers a lot of extra credit and her TAs are very gracious when grading.

All of her exams are open note (thank you Nancy) so if you can't pass you probably shouldn't be in college. Go to class and take notes on the lectures, she takes attendance but it's honestly pretty interesting. 1 easily graded project, 10/10 recommend taking as a GE course & GPA booster

Honestly was kind of rude, and talked about herself a lot. I didn't have a very good impression of her. Wasn't a hard class. You are able to use your notes on the tests, but I would still look over them before because it's a lot of information to know.

The class material is super easy but something about Dr. Rudd rubbed me the wrong way. She always acted like she had somewhere better to be, and spends a lot of time bragging about her accomplishments. Tests are  easy though, and there are several extra credit opportunities. She has no personal style but is somehow the head of the design dep't
One of the worst classes I have taken at OSU. The course was extremely disorganized. Rudd also needs to get off her high horse. She is extremely rude and arrogant.

Easiest class at OSU. All tests are open note. You can use anything except a computer. Just take notes in class and you will get a 100% on tests. One easy solo project. One group project that they grade easy. Class is mandatory. Lots of Extra Credit

Open note mid-term and final, material covered in class is easy, but she puts detailed questions on the exams. She curved the whole class because she wants everyone to succeed! I love Nancy Rudd and am looking forward to taking more fashion classes with her.
Likes to flaunt that she's in charge, is very blunt and sometimes harsh. However, she's very knowledgable. Helped me whenever I asked.

Took her freshman seminar class, a look in the mirror. It was extremely boring, but it was a very easy A. Definite grade booster. It only meets once a week, so you're not wasting a lot of time. Rudd's really easy to please.

The class and all the material is so easy, just don't expect to connect with her. In fact, avoid her all together if you can. Turn in your work and run away. She seems to be on a power high and could use some public relations skills. Its surprising because she seems pleasant when she teaches. Expect her to play favorites as well

Freshman Seminar Class- A Look in the Mirror: Body Image and Wellness, was a great class. Very easy A if you attend class and do the assignments. Classes are two hours and extremely boring but attendence is mandatory so go but if you're tired, napping won't hurt!
She is clearly NOT helpful at all, acts like a sourpuss, and seems to dislike everyone that doesn't suck up to her.
No Comments

This class series (3 quarters) is the best program you can take to prepare yourself for a career in product design.  Dr. Rudd is an amazing representative of the textiles department and has proved to be a great professor.  This program is all based on your own effort and dedication therefore it requires your full attention....I loved it!
A great professor with a huge heart!  :)

dr. rudd is an incredibly caring person (if you are on her good side).  /he has gone out of her way to help students by letting them work (in the real world) as well as do their class work on their spare time.  She is great if she likes you! KEEP ON HER GOOD SIDE
Easy and interesting class, not sure about the Star Trek subculture...but nonetheless an easy A.
No Comments
Identity of dress

summary_comment: Professor Patterson is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, evident in his deep commitment to ensuring students understand the subject matter and enjoying it. His approach involves engaging projects and straightforward grading, with no exams or additional homework required.
summary_comment_short: Professor Patterson is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, genuinely passionate about his subject, and committed to ensuring students understand the material. His approach involves engaging projects and minimal traditional homework, making his courses enjoyable and accessible.

Ratings.comment: One of my favorite teachers ever. Really wants to know that students understand and enjoy his subject. A few projects and grading isn't tough. No exams or other homework.

summary_comment: Professor Mayo is known for his rigorous and demanding teaching style, pushing students to think critically and produce high-quality work. However, many students find his expectations unreasonably high and his methods, particularly his focus on personal anecdotes and lack of adherence to the syllabus, to be inconsistent and frustrating. Despite this, some students acknowledge his intellectual depth and the positive impact he has had on their development.
summary_comment_short: Professor Mayo is known for his rigorous and demanding teaching style, pushing students to think critically and produce high-quality work, but his approach is often seen as ambiguous and unstructured, leading to frustration and poor grades for some. Despite this, many acknowledge his expertise and intellectual depth, appreciating his commitment to excellence and personal integrity.

Ratings.comment: Legacy. Being the first Black Industrial Designer to receive a degree in the United States & his work w Lutron Co. are, as professional achievements goes, quite commendable. Unfortunately, the legacy of his teaching is of someone who used his position & status to willfully create ambiguous and unattainable expectations for his student so they fail.
without a doubt the worst professor i've ever had. he was stubborn, outdated, horribly unorganized, and would go on random conspiratorial tangents.

Good teacher, but very set in his ways of thinking. Makes you really go the extra mile for an A, which is difficult at times but you will produce a lot more material because of it! A little too stubborn sometimes, though, doesn't like too much "out of the box" thinking.

He spends the entire class talking about himself and his company lutron, does not follow the syllabus, and is completely inconsistent at critiques.  He also gave me my first and only C in 4 years (and I graduated ****laude) and would not offer an explanation when I questioned him.
Noel Mayo is the best instructor I have ever had. As people have stated before, he makes you work, he makes you think for yourself and I feel that I am a much better person because of his influence.
Tough professor but a great person. Have to work VERY hard for his classes.
No Comments
intermitten "teacher". many valid points, and an intilectual man, but also very stubborn and stuck in his ways. has a factor of intimidation.

Very approachable and friendly however he isnt just going to hand it to you on a plate. You have to work for everything and not slack off. Very intelligent and loves to see you are doing more than the majority of students.
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Esquivel is highly regarded by some students for pushing them to excel and produce high-quality work, though others found his teaching style challenging and unhelpful, citing issues with tardiness, an overly critical approach, and a focus on personal appearance over student needs. His effectiveness seems to depend significantly on the student's perspective, with some finding him inspirational and others deeming him ineffective or even detrimental to their learning experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Esquivel is polarizing among students, with some finding his teaching challenging yet rewarding, particularly for those aiming to excel in design, while others criticize him for being unhelpful, late, and overly critical. His approach is seen as pushing students to think outside the box but often leaves them feeling unsupported and frustrated.

Ratings.comment: Literally the darkest time of my life because of his insanity

Showed up late, and loves to hear himself talk.  Would go on rants about new age philosophy, and was not very helpful to students at all. At times it seemed he was more concerned with his reputation and fashion. I did not get enough out of my education in his program at OSU. Very difficult to talk to and approach.

His constructive criticism has given me the best work in my portfolio.  He liked us to work on the cutting edge of the industry and really pushed for us to go beyond sanity.  I believe I am a much better designer for having him as a prof for 4 classes.

Be prepared to do a lot of work. However, he is fairly generous on grading. Don't be intimidated by this guy, he is actually a really genuine person and very helpful if you approach him with some confidence. You'll come out a better design student once you've had him.

very unhelpful professor.  generally makes the students feel bad about their work but offers no constructive criticism to help them.  he usually arrives to class at least 30 minutes late and leaves talking on his cell phone 30 minutes early.  p.s. michael hutchence circa 1987 called and he wants his hair and pants back.

Gabe is probably the worst teacher I've ever had.  I don't know why he is actually a teacher (or why he still has his job).  He doesn't help students with problems they have with their work, he only offers unconstructive criticism, he's always late to class and has a very arrogant attitude.  (but he does look good in his Gucci suits)
Hated him
He is fantastic.

summary_comment: Professor Desjardins is highly regarded by some students for her passionate and engaging teaching style, which inspires and supports their professional development. However, others find her to be extremely unapproachable and set unrealistically high expectations, leading to difficult grading and a challenging learning environment.
summary_comment_short: Professor Desjardins is highly regarded by some students for her passionate and engaging teaching style, which significantly impacts their education and career, while others find her to be unapproachable and overly strict, with high expectations that can be discouraging for beginners.

Ratings.comment: Quite possibly the most ineffective and unapproachable teacher I have  encountered at Ohio State. Every question I had was met with a very brief response, and assignments were graded incredibly hard even with all syllabus criteria being met. I felt as though I wasn't artistic enough for her standards, even though I put much effort into my work.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH THIS PROFESSOR. She has outrageous expectations of pre-design and design minor students. She expects an understanding of design concepts even though this is some students first ever design class. Very hard grader and does not understand student work loads or how to teach a class. Oblivious to the amount of work she assig
Not what I expected. This class was interesting and very hands-on. Projects were an awesome way to learn something I thought was going to be more theory.

I would highly recommend this professor. What sets her apart is an attitude that is inspired by the value of the topic, and she goes out of her way to engage and encourage students to be professional. Her interest, insight, and experiences make her an exceptional instructor. She made a very valuable difference in my education and my career.
A professor with a lot of heart and empathy. She gave me a lot of practical advice and continues to support my interests. She is an exceptional instructor.

Terrible.If I didn't need this class I would have dropped it in the first week. Don't try to have an opinon or a unique perspective. She will superimpose her boring & closeminded aesthetic over everything. She took any  interest I had in design/typography & destroyed it. She tries to force people to pay attention, but she says nothing of value.
She is an awesome teacher. Web need more like her.

summary_comment: Professor Reynaldo is highly dedicated and passionate about teaching, with a strong emphasis on fundamentals and problem-solving. His classes are demanding and require significant commitment from students, but many find his teaching inspiring and valuable. While some students appreciate his energy and innovative teaching methods, others find his lectures and interactions with students to be repetitive or favoritism-based, leading to mixed reviews.
summary_comment_short: Professor Reynaldo is highly dedicated and passionate about teaching, known for his demanding yet effective methods that challenge students to excel. His expertise and energy are evident, though his teaching style can be intense and sometimes controversial among students.

Ratings.comment: It's very apparent he is dedicated to teaching. Tony has an extensive background in type and a unique way of teaching the fundamentals. He's a hard teacher for sure, but he is committed to helping students who show up and bring an equal level of commitment to the classroom. He should be full time at AiOC, he is the best teacher we have for sure.

Tony gave us a lot of work, some of it not making any sense at all for what we were there for. However, he would never explain things clearly and would contradict himself all the time for what he was asking for. One of the toughest teachers I have ever had, and I have had some tough teachers in the past. The army was easier than this.

Without question one of the most amazing and energetic professors I have ever had. Tony brings a ton of energy and passion to his class. The MacGyver class was one of the coolest courses I have taken yet. The Twinkie smash was a challenging project and Tony knows how to inspire students. OSU needs to make that class required for EVERYONE!

Tony is a great professor.  He is tough and expects a lot out of his students but always willing to help.  He really knows his stuff and enjoys teaching it.  I enjoyed his class.  Wish we had more professors like him at OSU.  He is high energy and very dedicated.

Without a doubt the most driven/dedicated teacher I've ever had! Tony has a fire to push students in design and create "true" problem solvers. He has fun teaching that makes everyone want to learn and even though he kicked our butts it helped make the work I did stronger. Simply put Tony believes in us which makes us believe in ourselves.
Awesome, truly inspiring and always willing to lend a hand if you need it. He expects a lot but is willing to give the same in return.

He's so full of himself. At first he seems cool but he never stops talking about himself and about how great teh Design program is. The class is boring for the most part but the projects are fun. I got an A easily. And he definately does pick favorites.

He was energetic and fun at first. However, this become annoying after some time and he plays favorites often. Sometimes he is disrespectful. Don't get me wrong, some days we laughed till fell off of our stools. I just in general found him annoying and immature.

Tony is the man.... I rated him hot because he was asking about that.... lol.  But he is truly the most motivating and energetic, helpful, cool, fun, knowledgeable, ridiculously great professor.  It would be an experience to have him an one would never regret it...
Tony's energy and enthusiasm for design made his courses valuable experiences. Very helpful and will push one to succeed.
Color Theory class, very interesting... a lot of work for 3 credits (a huge paper, presentation, several time-consuming projects), but one of the best classes you'll take!  Tony knows his stuff
No Comments

Great class!  Definitely a challenge and plenty of work, but all really interesting and educational.  Tony's really supportive and approachable, which helps in a class where you're constantly getting critiqued.  All in all, fun class!

summary_comment: Professor Burns is perceived as having very high, often unattainable standards that students find unreasonable, particularly for those not aiming for top-tier design programs. She justifies this by claiming the real-world demands are similarly harsh, which some students interpret as an excuse to avoid actually teaching the material.
summary_comment_short: Professor Burns is perceived as having very high standards that students find unrealistic and unhelpful, as she fails to provide substantive teaching or support, instead justifying her approach by claiming it mirrors the demands of the professional world. Students view her as ineffective in her role as an educator.

Ratings.comment: She is a horrible teacher, her standards are outrageously high for students that arent even trying to get into the design program. Her excuse for this is, this is how the real world is. she uses this excuse to get away with not teaching anything or doing her actual job.

summary_comment: Professor Jacoby is known for his highly informative and practical teaching approach, focusing on student-led presentations and book-based assessments. However, some students find his teaching style less traditional, noting that he does not actively lecture but instead facilitates learning through these methods.
summary_comment_short: Professor Jacoby is known for his highly informative and helpful approach in Design 35055, providing students with valuable insights. However, his teaching method primarily involves student presentations and book-based testing rather than traditional lecturing.

Ratings.comment: Design 35055 is the class I took with him. Very informative and helpful.
he doesn't even teach he just has students do presentations and then tests on the books

summary_comment: Professor Wiggins is highly regarded for her enthusiasm and dedication to her students' success, often described as one of the fairest and most passionate instructors. Her support extends beyond the classroom, helping students build their resumes and portfolios. However, some students have criticized her approach, finding her lectures redundant and her interactions with students to be rude and unhelpful.
summary_comment_short: Professor Wiggins is highly regarded for her enthusiasm and dedication to her students' success, making complex topics accessible and fostering a supportive learning environment. Her passion for design and its real-world applications is evident, and she goes above and beyond to help students build their resumes and portfolios.

Ratings.comment: Emily is honestly an amazing professor. She is so enthusiastic about teaching and really wants her students to succeed. You learn a lot about design and life in general in her class. I wish could have more classes with her.

Emily is awesome and not just as a professor but as a person to network with. She's really passionate about teaching and about using design in the real world. She's also open to talk about building resume/portfolio to help her students find success outside of class. Don't be afraid to talk to her! She's really open

Emily is one of the fairest and more enthusiastic professors I've ever had. I had some personal issues that caused me to miss some classes and she was understanding, patient, and helpful. The class can be difficult if you haven't taken design before  but she is always happy to spend the time to get you on track.
Very passionate.

Terrible professor who apparently knows very little about the subject at hand. Extremely rude to other students and genuinely just ruins the fun of taking a design course. She also copies and pastes text from the book to use as slides so if you read the book attending lecture is not only unnecessary but also painfully redundant. Terrible professor

summary_comment: Professor Zavotka is known for her mixed teaching approach, providing helpful advice when directly asked but often coming across as dismissive and rude otherwise. Students describe her as inconsistent, with some finding her supportive and others feeling she treats them unfairly, especially those who question her or ask for clarification. Overall, her teaching style seems to significantly impact students' experiences, ranging from positive to highly negative.
summary_comment_short: Professor Zavotka is known for her mixed reputation among students. While some find her helpful and engaging, providing personalized advice when asked, others describe her as rude, dismissive, and mean, especially towards those who question her or do not align with her preferences.

Ratings.comment: Gives helpful advice when asked. Teaches on a personal level.

Before I had Dr.Zavotka as a professor I was a little nervous, because of what I had heard previously. I think if you are putting effort into you work, you listen, and don't ask questions that are already answered in the syllabus, then she is fairly easy to please. Just be respectful and take pride in your work and she will too.

Loved design and had "wonderful" professors at a previous university but one year w/Zavotka soured me so much that I switched majors.  She will be kind to you if you are willing to be her pet or simply do not ask questions. Overall, she is mean and very,very rude.
She is rude and dismissive. Do not ask questions! Made me want to switch majors.

She doesn't have a good side. I tried to stay on it. She spoke to me and a few others like we were something scraped off the bottom of her shoe all the time while being sweet as pie to her favorites. Just grin and bear it and don't let her make you feel bad about yourself!

All other comments sooo true...just basically go to class and act like you care, but keep your mouth shut and don't ask her questions, ask other students.  Stay on her good side, kiss her ass and you're in.
If you're a design student you're stuck with Zavotka for most of your 4 years.  She really isn't that bad, just stay on her good side and stay away from here on her bad days.

If you have a question, ask everyone you can find before going to her. She will barrade you and act like you're stupid even if it's a perfectly legitimate question. She's nice to students in proportion to how much she likes their projects and since design is subjective, it can be frusterating when she's arbitrarily hot and cold.

I have had Zavotka for many classes, and this was the only tolerable one. It seems that if you are good at her projects, then she likes you. But before I got the hang of her class format, she hated me and didn't hold it back. But in the last class, I got t
I agree with the other comment...as long as you go to classes and get your work in on time, the classes aren't too hard...stay on her good side to get the most help out of her

Make sure you go to class, she gives good examples and everything in her notes usually will eventually need to be memorized. Pay close attention to detail and instructions...her instructions (although she thinks are great)are sometimes unclear!! You're better off if she knows your face and name.
Nice teacher, knows what she is talking about, hard to read, enjoys what she does

summary_comment: Professor Stone is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, described as both humorous and engaging, with a focus on making complex topics relatable and encouraging critical thinking. Students appreciate his preparedness and willingness to assist, though they note the need for consistent effort to succeed in his challenging yet rewarding classes.
summary_comment_short: Professor Stone is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, which fosters critical thinking and connects complex topics to everyday life. Students find his classes both challenging and rewarding, requiring preparation and effort but ultimately enhancing their learning experience.

Ratings.comment: Best professor I have ever had, very helpful, extremely interesting, and funny as hell.
good lecturer. relates things to everyday life. encouraged critical thinking.
ok, i've got issues with the rating system here. he got a 2 for difficulty (more difficuly), but i think thats better than a 5 for (easy) any day. they gotta fix this wack system
very funny man and very interesting class. Need to be prepared for each class and make sure put in extra effort in his classes.
very cool prof, interesting, will help you with anything

summary_comment: Professor Jakes is known for covering a vast amount of material, which can be challenging and overwhelming. While some students found her knowledgeable and engaging, many criticized her teaching methods, noting that she often fails to clearly convey important information and aligns her exams poorly with in-class assignments. Despite the difficulties, a few students appreciated her passion and found the class interesting and enjoyable.
summary_comment_short: Professor Jakes is known for covering a vast amount of material, which can be challenging and overwhelming for students. While some find her passionate and knowledgeable, many struggle with her teaching style, finding her lectures unclear and her assessments disconnected from in-class work.

Ratings.comment: Jakes was one of the worst professors I have ever had. I was interested in learning about the material, though she taught me nothing! This is not the type of course that can be self taught. She taught me nothing. Her inclass assignments and exams have nothing to do with each other. Find someone else to take this course from!!

Jakes is all over the place. There is SO much material - study notes, outlines, online quizzes, EVERYTHING. Probably a good thing we're switching to semesters, more time to cover all of this. She's not always clear on what's due when, so pay close attention to everything. It was difficult.

Jakes class was hard, but only because it was a lot of information to be covered. I think that she's a great teacher who really cares about the students. She is extremely knowledgeable about the topic and is willing to answer questions and talk outside of class.

This class is hard so be prepared for it.  Use past quizzes and midterms to study, don't rely so much on your notes.  I studied only my notes for the first quiz and failed.  After I learned to study, with the past quizzes, I started getting A's.  Once you learn to study for the class, it's not so bad.
She is hardcore, its a course that has enough material to cover 2 full quarters, STUDY STUDY STUDY!!!!!!!

Her notes that are online or availble to buy are not legible. Her lectures are erratic she knows her stuff but shes not good at actually teaching it she throws info at you in lecture and in her excitement doesnt make it clear whats actually important. Apparently curves are not to raise a poor class average so dont count on it if one person has an A
No Comments

I really enjoyed this class. As long as you go to lecture and pay attention you will do fine. It is all really interesting, and it stinks that the labs are ending because those were really helpful. This class isn't as hard as people make it sound as long as you just pay attention. Jakes is crazy, but that is what makes the class fun and interesting

Jakes is crazy. Her quizzes are like midterms and her midterms suck.  She doesn't care about the students and she gets mad when you don't remember every detail from the class.  Lab is no fun either but they're getting rid of it next year.

She is crazy, she will teach you a lot but is crazy!!! you will know more about alpaka then you ever will need to know! word of advice.....zone her out, but listen to what she says (you will understand)

I like Dr. Jakes, even though I know a lot of others didn't.  She is very knowledgeable and excited about the material and loves to share everything she can in the alloted time. Her quizzes are hard, but the way to pass is to read the text, attend class, and keep up with her notes.  Try hard to stay awake, even though it's early, she will notice.
This woman is psycho!! She yells if you don't come to class, but if you come and sleep, she yells too. You can't win! Plus the lab part was really confusing!

Really did not like this woman...as a person or as a prof. Questions on exams and quizzes are really confusing and ridicules you if you don't know something or if you nod off during her 8:30 am class, which a lot of people did because she is also boring to listen to.

Does not care about students. Answer emails with cut and paste answers, and embarasses students who ask questions in class that she feels the student should already know. She is not patient, and expects everyone to know everything before lecture.

She is not a nice woman. She can be very mean, and answers any question you may have rudely. Her quizzes are harder than the midterm and final. You need to memorize the the text book to pass the quizzes. The questions can be very random and off the wall.

summary_comment: Professor Butter is known for his intense and often harsh teaching style, which some students find demotivating and unconstructive, while others credit him with pushing them to excel and achieving significant professional success. His passion and dedication to design are widely acknowledged, though his methods and personality are frequently described as challenging and potentially damaging to students' confidence.
summary_comment_short: Professor Butter is known for his intense and often unconstructive criticism, which some students find demoralizing and counterproductive, while others credit him with pushing them to achieve great success. His teaching style is highly polarizing, with some students appreciating his passion and high standards, while others find him arrogant and demeaning.

Ratings.comment: The man is beyond proud, he has zero accountability for what he says. He is not fit to teach or design. He would be good at detailing cars- full time

Funny I was a student when Reinhart was in his prime back in the late 70s. We started with about 25 students in his class and I believe there were 12 at the end. He was about as tough as they come. He was a great designer though, and I was inspired by his passion and his personal work at the time. Love his passion! He raised the bar really high.

Butter is pretty slick, best when when chillin in the fridge, can be spread, and is best on pancakes. Not very clear since butter is usually an opaque yellow but delicious none the less. overall I'd recommend this butter to anyone needing an edible lubricant.   710, 1010 with rice.   *Not to be confused but Butters from South Park
When dealing with Butter, expect 100% criticism with 0% of which being constructive. Lives to kill dreams and deter students from the field.

Reinhart Butter is passionate and gifted in design and expects students to be just as dedicated. I grew to know and respect him quite well and credit him with much of my success. I am now Design Director at a Fortune 100 company. Thanks Reinhart!

Those who don't like him is because they cannot take any pressure. He was my major professor 20+ years ago. He really emptied my bucket and refilled it with new insight. I am very grateful for Reinhart and what he did to me. I am a college professor too and now understand why he did what he did. :-)

This man told me at my final senior review that I would never find a job. He shrugged and then said, "It is all water under the bridge." He is condescending and a know-it-all.  The day he told me I would never find a job, I vowed that someday I would never treat any students as he treated me. I am now Chair of a Design School. Guess he was wrong.

The  most arrogant, mean and depressing individual I've ever met. Arrogance is offensive but tolerable if the person is interesting, but Butter isn't. Simon Cowell w/o charm.  Learned nothing except self loathing.  Told me I lacked the talent to be a designer.  I now manage a firm of more than 300 people - 299 more than he ever did! Good riddance

Reinhart Butter is one of the main reasons OSU?s Industrial Design programs has been rated one of the best in the world for over 25 years. He demanded the best and accepted nothing less. For those of us who appreciated his passion and inspiration, he has left an indelible mark.

This professor is worth rating even if I took his class 20+ years ago. He is the most sadistic and condescending person I've ever met. He humiliates students in class and made several seniors breakdown after presentations. He said I didn't have the intelligence to be there! I'm now a college professor and respect my students, thanks to Dr. Butter.

founder of OSU design, he has been here a long time.  he is the quintessential german, but has a good sense of humor if you get to know him (which is rare).  he is difficult to learn design from, and picks favorites.
Very blunt, very difficult, very unapproachable and intimidating. IS very oppinionated with a wavering HATES people coming late to class... must be on time on the dot
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Kellner is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality and genuine care for his students' well-being and growth. His classes are known for their relaxed atmosphere, minimalistic yet insightful assignments, and flexible scheduling options. Students consistently praise his investment in their success and his ability to provide both a rigorous education and supportive mentorship.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kellner is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, characterized by a supportive and relaxed classroom environment that fosters student growth and well-being. Students consistently praise his genuine investment in their success and his willingness to accommodate their needs, making his classes both educational and mentor-like.

Ratings.comment: Michael was one of the best instructors I encountered during my first semester at OSU. His class was so chill and relaxed that most students went even though attendance wasn't really required. He genuinely cares about his students' wellbeing and sharing valuable information through lectures. Assignments were simple, interesting, and rewarding.

Hands down the best professor Ive had at OSU. On top of being a great teacher, he clearly cares about students growth and personal well-being. Whenever he sensed anxiety about a deadline, he offered to move it, letting us focus instead on fully realizing our ideas. Learning from him felt both like a world class education and a close mentorship.
Hands down the best professor I've had at OSU. A fundamentally great person.
He is real nice.

Mr. Kellner is an amazing professor. He's genuinely invested in making students into better ones and is super cool. He's relatable. Classes show up as twice a week but on the first day you can choose to come only either Wednesday or Friday, not both. Lots of reading and weekly summaries. No exams and 3 big essays per semester. Definitely recommend

Michael is the best professor ever. Hes genuinely invested in students success and will try his best to help students achieve what theyre aiming for. If you be already got a solid drawing foundation the class isnt very challenging. However, it really is important that you show up and try your hardest - he definitely knows if someone is slacking
Michael is one of the best professors out there. He genuinely cares about his students and allows them to break the rules of design.
Absolutely fantastic.
Michael truly cares for each individual and how well they understand the assignments, grades given, and material covered. Wish I could take him with me through my whole design career
The best, most caring person I have ever met. He truly is an inspirational teacher loved by all of his students. If only every professor was like him.
literally the best. I am truly sad that I may never have him as a professor again.

Michael is truly passionate for art and his job. He is extremely understanding and wants everyone to succeed. I only thought this class was hard because I had never taken a drawing class before but I was lucky to have an instructor that pushed me and allowed project limitations to be interpreted in our own way.

This was one of my favorite classes. Michael is a kind teacher who is willing to help you as much as you need. He's there to help you improve on your abilities and makes class a fun experience. He'll crack a joke once in a while and even adds in a life lesson here and there. Definitely take this class if you have the opportunity.

I took one of Michael's classes for the Design minor, and I am planning on taking another! He was very helpful, and seemed to legitimately want his students to do well. I learned a lot in his class, and enjoyed it very much. His anecdotes are quite good, and he encouraged us to be creative and play up our own strengths.

Michael is more a friend than a professor. He is incredibly wise with anything drawing and much beyond. However he only makes a point to help students, and his emails quite frequently made my day. He will gladly help any way he can, and gives great feedback as to how someone can improve in the classroom and in life.
He's so awesome. Helpful, smart, explains things very well... We all love him, hes the best
Michael Kellner is amazing. He is hilarious and a really great guy. Loved his class. Love him. Definitely one of my all time favorite professors.

I took it online. Prof. Kellner seems like a nice guy, and he's very passionate and knowledgeable about art. Though I wasn't impressed with the class itself, it involves mostly reading/writing and very little designing/art making, good for non-artists taking it for GE. An easy A as long as you don't miss any discussion post/projects.
